intro: Mormodes tuxtlensis, commonly known as the Tuxtlán orchid, is a species of orchid native to Mexico. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in the understory of tropical forests. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a distinctive coloration that ranges from white to pale pink. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
